classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, B3, (B4 [lab] must be completed with either B2 or B3), B1-B5 elective, C1, C2, C3, C4, D2, D3, D4, D5, and F. C4, D5, and F should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). One (1) course must be selected from B1, in addition to STAT217. No POLS class may be taken to fulfill GE D5. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C3, C4, D3, D4, D5, or F.

Select one course from the following: ANT201; GEOG150; HIST110, HIST111, HIST222, HIST223.

Any POLS Major Course (300-400 level elective) can go here. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward upper division Political Science electives. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count towards the concentration. A total of 4 units of either POLS386 or POLS387 may count toward Free Electives. Any combination of POLS386 and POLS387 may be taken for a maximum of 12 units total credit for the degree.

Any ICS course can go here. A minimum of 28 units of coursework are selected by the student and approved by the student's academic advisor. 20 of these must be at the 300-400 level and 16 units must carry a POLS prefix.
